1.Pros: Schedule is usually pretty flexible and I get enough hours. The usual customers make it worth being there.
1.Cons: Doesn't pay enough and doesn't evaluate all employees as well at they should. I have been working for the company for almost 4 years now and have been a manager for around 2 1/2 years. I make less than some crew members and some managers who have been employees / managers who haven't been there/ managers as long as I have.

2.Pros: Helped teach me responsibility regardless of the lack of training and awful management
2.Cons: Crazy busyMinimum wageHigh turnoverLack of trainingUnderstaffed

3.Pros: There are some good days, some pretty decent managers but you have to watch your time
3.Cons: They play with your hours and time. Get paid every other week. Managers do not fit the manger roll

4.Pros: Flexible schedule, food discounts, great GM,
4.Cons: Low pay, small raises, poor benefits.

5.Pros: discounted meals, good place to help start career
5.Cons: fast food industry, many menial tasks

6.Pros: free food and a lot of other benefits
6.Cons: schedule is constantly changing. work environment is stressful

8.Pros: Low barrier for entryMeet lots of people

9.Pros: I got some experience full time managing
9.Cons: Their training program isn't all that they make it out to be. It's actually really bad and they leave you to figure a lot of things out on your own. They never give you time to actually complete their online training class and then hold it against you when you ask for a raise or promotion.They don't pay well at all in comparison to industry standard and certainly don't pay managers well for the amount of work we had to do
